page.title: 06THE OYSTER FARM
page.content: The farming of oysters was started in June 1984 by the landlords, the National Trust for Scotland, with financial support from the Highland and Islands Development Board. The farmed oysters are not the natural oysters of Britain (O. Edulis) but Pacific oysters (C. Gigas) which do not reproduce in our colder waters. Unlike fin-fish, shellfish do not need to be artificially fed and instead feed on plankton which is abundant in Canna Bay, especially during the months of June to September when the oysters grow at their fastest rate. The oyster spat were bought from the Isle of Colonsay, at three different stages of growth so that an eighteen month trial could monitor the possibilities of a commercial business.
